sen.j: メンチカツまたはミンチカツは、豚肉や牛肉の挽肉（ミンチ）に、タマネギのみじん切り、食塩、コショウなどを混ぜて練り合わせ、小判型にして小麦粉、溶き卵、パン粉からなる衣をつけて油で揚げる肉料理である。
sen.e: Menchi katsu or minchi katsu is a meat dish, in which ground pork or beef (minchi) is mixed well with minced onions, salt and pepper, formed into flat ovals, coated with breading made of flour, beaten eggs and panko (Japanese-style coarse bread crumbs), and deep fried in oil.

Menchi katsu or minchi katsu is a meat dish, in which ground pork or beef (minchi) is mixed well with minced onions, salt and pepper, formed into flat ovals, coated with breading made of flour, beaten eggs and panko (Japanese-style coarse bread crumbs), and deep fried in oil.

Menchi katsu or minchi katsu is a meat dish, in which ground pork or beef (minchi) is mixed well with minced onions, salt and pepper, formed into flat ovals, coated with breading made of flour, beaten eggs and panko (Japanese-style coarse bread crumbs), and deep fried in oil.

sen.j: いうなれば、加熱前のハンバーグにカツレツの衣をつけて揚げたものである。
sen.e: In other words, it's a raw hamburger patty that is breaded like a cutlet and deep fried.
In other words, it's a raw hamburger patty that is breaded like a cutlet and deep fried.
In other words, it's a raw hamburger patty that is breaded like a cutlet and deep fried.
Its beginning and its name
Its beginning and its name
Origin and name
sen.cmt: 左記のようにしました。

tit.cmt: 左記のようにしました。

sen.j: 諸説があるが、明治に東京都台東区浅草の洋食店がミンスミートカツレツとして販売したのが起源とされている。
sen.e: Various theories exist, but it is said to have started when a western-style restaurant in Asakusa, Daito ward, Tokyo sold it as mincemeat cutlet during the Meiji Period.
Various theories exist, but it is said to have started when a western-style restaurant in Asakusa, Daito ward, Tokyo sold it as mincemeat cutlet during the Meiji Period.
Various theories exist, but it is said to have been created by a western-style restaurant in Asakusa, Taito Ward, Tokyo, where it was sold as a "minced meat cutlet" during the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: mincemeat ですとメンチカツのミンチとは違う食べ物になるようですので、minced meat としました。To say a product started sounds a little odd to me so I've changed this to read a little more naturally.

sen.j: メンチの語源は挽肉で、メンチカツ、ミンチカツともに和製語である。
sen.e: The word menchi is derived from ground meat, and along with menchi katsu and minchi katsu, it is a word created in Japanese.
The word menchi is derived from ground meat, and along with menchi katsu and minchi katsu, it is a word created in Japanese.
The word menchi is derived from ground meat, and both 'menchi katsu' and 'minchi katsu' are words coined in Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 諸説があるが、関西地方では兵庫県神戸市兵庫区にある純神戸肉三ッ輪屋精肉店（明治34年創業、現三ツ輪屋総本店）が、東京の洋食店の「メンチボール」をヒントに昭和初期に、二代目水野三次氏が命名考案した「ミンチカツ」が始まりとされる。
sen.e: There are various theories. In the Kansai area, it is said to have begun at Genuine Kobe Beef Mitsuwaya Butcher Shop (present-day Mitsuwaya Sohonten (main store), established in 1902) during the early Showa Period, using 'menchiboru' (meatballs) from a western-style restaurant in Tokyo as a hint. The second owner, Mitsuji MIZUNO invented and named it 'menchi katsu.'

There are various theories. In the Kansai area, it is said to have begun at Genuine Kobe Beef Mitsuwaya Butcher Shop (present-day Mitsuwaya Sohonten (main store), established in 1902) during the early Showa Period, using 'menchiboru' (meatballs) from a western-style restaurant in Tokyo as a hint. The second owner, Mitsuji MIZUNO invented and named it 'menchi katsu.'

There are various theories; in the Kansai region, it is said to have begun at Genuine Kobe Beef Mitsuwaya Butcher Shop (present-day Mitsuwaya Sohonten (main store), established in 1901) during the early Showa period, using 'menchi boru' (meatballs) from a western-style restaurant in Tokyo as a hint, and the second owner, Mitsuji MIZUNO invented and named it 'menchi katsu.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、メンチカツという表現を用いる地域においてはしばしば「メンチ」と省略される。
sen.e: In the regions where the word menchi katsu is used, it is often abbreviated as 'menchi.' However, in the Kansai area, minchi is a word used solely to mean ground meat, and the word 'minchi' is not used as an abbreviated word to imply minchi katsu.

In the regions where the word menchi katsu is used, it is often abbreviated as 'menchi.' However, in the Kansai area, minchi is a word used solely to mean ground meat, and the word 'minchi' is not used as an abbreviated word to imply minchi katsu.
In the regions where the word 'menchi katsu' is used, the word is often abbreviated as 'menchi.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、関西ではミンチはあくまでもひき肉を意味する単語であるため、ミンチカツの短縮形として「ミンチ」という呼称が用いられることはない。
sen.e: However, in the Kansai area, 'minchi' is a word used solely to mean ground meat, and the word 'minchi' is not used as an abbreviation for 'minchi katsu'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 関西地方では「メンチ」という言葉は、「メンチを切る」という、喧嘩の際に使われるガラの悪い表現を連想させることがある。
sen.e: In the Kansai area, the word 'menchi' can be associated with the expression, 'menchi wo kiru' (to glare at someone), a vulgar expression used when fighting.
In the Kansai area, the word 'menchi' can be associated with the expression, 'menchi wo kiru' (to glare at someone), a vulgar expression used when fighting.
In the Kansai region, the word 'menchi' can suggest the expression 'menchi wo kiru' (to glare at someone), a vulgar expression used when fighting.

sen.j: これは、首都圏方言の俗語表現で“ガン（眼）をつける”または“ガンを飛ばす”と同義である。
sen.e: This has the same meaning as "gan wo tsukeru" or "gan wo tobasu" (both meaning to glare at someone), expressions in slang in the Tokyo metropolitan area.

sen.j: したがって、関西地方では「メンチ」あるいは「メンチカツ」という表現は避けられる。
sen.e: Therefore, in the Kansai area, the word 'menchi' or 'menchi katsu' is avoided.

sen.j: ソースなどをかけてそのまま食べる。

sen.j: コロッケと並んで惣菜屋の定番である。

sen.j: 一般にメンチカツ・ミンチカツは庶民的な洋食のイメージがある。
sen.e: In general, menchi katsu or minchi katsu carry the image of inexpensive western-style Japanese food. However, luxury food versions made with Kobe beef or Matsuzaka beef are also available.

sen.j: 同種の挽き肉生地でゆで卵を丸ごと包み、同様の衣をつけて揚げたものはスコッチエッグと呼ばれる。
sen.e: A whole boiled egg wrapped with a similar ground meat mixture, breaded in a similar manner and deep fried is called scotch egg.
